vulnerabilities: External Control of File Name or Path
Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
description: The function is vulnerable to path traversal (CWE-22) as it uses user-supplied input to construct a file path without proper validation or sanitization. This could allow an attacker to access, modify, or delete files outside of the intended directory. The function is also vulnerable to external control of file name or path (CWE-73) as it uses user-supplied input in the 'url' parameter to determine the file name and path for the downloaded file. This could allow an attacker to overwrite any file on the system. Lastly, the function is vulnerable to code injection (CWE-94) as it uses user-supplied input in the 'url' parameter to make HTTP requests without proper validation or sanitization. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious code into the HTTP request.
